com.dgis.input.evdev.devices

Class JoystickState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dgis.input.evdev.devices.JoystickState

  • public class JoystickState
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the state of a joystick (buttons and axes) Copyright (C) 2009 Giacomo Ferrari
    Author:
    Giacomo Ferrari

      int getAxisMaxValue(int axis)
      Queries the largest value ever seen on a given axis for calibration purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumButtons

        public int getNumButtons()
        Gets the number of buttons reported by this joystick.
        Returns:
        The number of buttons reported.

      • getNumAxes

        public int getNumAxes()
        Gets the number of axes reported by this joystick.
        Returns:
        The number of axes reported.

      • getButtonState

        public boolean getButtonState(int button)
        Queries the state of a joystick button.
        Parameters:
        button - The button number to check. Valid ranges are 0 to getNumButtons()-1.
        Returns:
        The state of the button.

      • getAxisState

        public int getAxisState(int axis)
        Queries the state of a joystick axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis number to check. Valid ranges are 0 to getNumAxes()-1.
        Returns:
        The state of the axis, typically in the range +-32768.
        See Also:
        getAxisMaxValue(int), getAxisMinValue(int)

      • getAxisMinValue

        public int getAxisMinValue(int axis)
        Queries the smallest value ever seen on a given axis for calibration purposes.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis to check. Valid ranges are 0 to getNumButtons()-1.
        Returns:
        The smallest value ever seen on this axis.

      • getAxisMaxValue

        public int getAxisMaxValue(int axis)
        Queries the largest value ever seen on a given axis for calibration purposes.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis to check. Valid ranges are 0 to getNumButtons()-1.
        Returns:
        The largest value ever seen on this axis.
